climbs.name: Fingers, I am sorry
climbs.fa: Andy Bowen (maybe, or not, seemed untouched)

content.description:
Start just left of

Baby Pumpkins

, (feet on the rock coming out of the bottom dirt part) right hand on sloping jug thing, left on your choice of crimps, barbaric right hand to evil little pocket, tip toes, and reach over for the awesome positive crimper towards the corner. Make an athletic swing to the left, heel hook on the corner, work your way up the face heading back right, and top out.
content.location:
This is left of

Baby Pumpkins

.

content.description:
This is a monster with awesome exposure on this awesome rock. See the picture to get an idea of this line.

The first hold can be reached, if you stand on the rock just below the "I wonder if you can grab that" chip and sloper. You literally have to use the dirt and loose rocks for you feet to start the climb. Pull up however you can to make the top of that protruding rock, it is better than it looks. I found bumping the left up first to be helpful, match, make a desperate high left foot to pull on to the face, move left and up the corner.
content.protection: Pad and spotter, but just don't fall.
content.location: On the west side of Mushroom Rock.

content.description:
The Blue Bottle climbs a steep overhang on a great series of edges.

Sit start with a left hand sidepull and a right hand on a sloping sidepull hueco. From there, throw up a left heel, reach a left three-finger sloper edge, then bump the right hand up to a sloper, then a three-finger crimp, and then to a three-finger incut edge. Match a left hand next to it, throw a right up to the jug sidepull, reach the left hand incut edge, then finish up the bumps (same finish as ?Baby Pumpkins?).
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The landing is good, but it is sloping, and there are some rocks just right of where the problem climbs.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Mushroom Rock.

content.description:
Baby Pumpkins climbs a great overhang, the movement is fun, the rock is top notch, and the landing is adequate.

Stand start with hands matched on the hueco's large sidepulls.  From there, move a left hand to the pinch and a right hand to the sharp incut crimp.  At this point, make a big left hand move to the incut crimp rail (crux, fun!), traverse slightly right using the rail, and top it out on the large bumps.
content.protection: A few pads, the landing is clear but slightly sloped.
content.location: This ascends the south face of Mushroom Rock.
